title: Understanding the Unprotect Sheet Option
text: To unprotect a worksheet, you need to access the 'Review' tab in your spreadsheet application. This is where you can find the option to unprotect the sheet.

title: Locating the Unprotect Sheet Button
text: Once you're in the 'Review' tab, look for the 'Changes' group. This is where the 'Unprotect Sheet' button is located.

title: Entering the Password
text: After clicking 'Unprotect Sheet', a dialog box will appear asking for the password. Enter the correct password to unprotect the sheet.

hintAnswer: click 'Unprotect Sheet' (review|changes), type in the password in the password text box
title: Steps to Unprotect a Worksheet
text: Follow these steps: $$1$$. Click 'Unprotect Sheet' in the 'Review' tab under 'Changes'. $$2$$. Type in the password in the password text box.
choices: changes), type in the password in the password text box
type in the password in the password text box
